meanings.definition: A smaller network within a larger network, typically used for organizational or security purposes.
meanings.sent1: Our company's IT department set up a secure subnetwork for sensitive data.
meanings.sent2: The subnetwork allows different departments to communicate within the main network.
meanings.sent3: The subnetwork was like a secret club where only certain employees had access.
meanings.sent4: The subnetwork acted as a shield, protecting important information from outside threats.
meanings.sent5: Navigating through the subnetwork felt like exploring a hidden maze.

meanings.definition: To divide a network into smaller, more manageable sections.
meanings.sent1: We need to subnetwork the main system to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The IT team will subnetwork the server to enhance data flow.
meanings.sent3: I decided to subnetwork my tasks to focus on one at a time.
meanings.sent4: She managed to subnetwork her study schedule for better time management.
meanings.sent5: Subnetworking the network was like organizing a messy room into neat sections.
